title: Habib Metropolitan Bank says it will establish wholly-owned EC
summary: The Board of Directors of Habib Metropolitan Bank HMB a subsidiary of Habib Bank AG Zurich  Switzerland announced on Tuesday that it will establish an Exchange Company EC as a whollyowned subsidiary becoming the seventh banking entity to make such an announcement to date. This EC shall be a wholly owned subsidiary of Habib Metropolitan Bank Limited it added.

title: BAHL announces 115pc profit growth
summary: Soneri Bank Limited SNBL on Wednesday reported a more than threefold increase in its annual profit for 2023 boosted by higher interest income and lower provisions. The banks total nonmarkup expenses which include administrative and operating costs rose by 26.4 percent to Rs15.47 billion in 2023 from Rs12.24 billion in 2022 mainly due to inflation and business expansion.

title: Askari Bank announces to establish wholly-owned Exchange Company
summary: Askari Bank Limited has announced the establishment of an Exchange Company EC as a whollyowned subsidiary. In light of these reforms commercial banks engaged in foreign exchange business started the process of establishing whollyowned EC to cater to the needs of the public at large.

title: SBP Allows MCB Bank and Habib Metro to Start Currency Exchange Operations

title: Askari Bank latest to establish wholly-owned Exchange Company
summary: Askari Bank Limited a subsidiary of Fauji Foundation announced on Friday it will establish an Exchange Company EC as a whollyowned subsidiary becoming the eighth banking entity to make such an announcement to date. This EC shall be a wholly owned subsidiary of AKBL it added.

title: Askari Bank to Set Up Exchange Company
summary: Askari Bank Limited PSX AKBL is set to establish an Exchange Company with an authorized capital of Rs. The notice also highlighted that the Exchange Company will be a whollyowned subsidiary of AKBL.

title: Bank of Punjab considers wholly-owned Exchange Company
summary: In view of the recently introduced structural reforms by State Bank of Pakistan SBP in the ECs sector and challenges posed by the recent depreciation in Pakistani rupee in the open market leading banks have been encouraged to establish wholly owned ECs with an authorized capital of Rs2.5 billion said BoP. The bank said that the establishment of an EC is subject to approval from SBP and compliance with relevant laws and regulations.
